intro: Eriospermum papilliferum, commonly known as the hairy eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a short, upright stem with rough, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine, papillate structures. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a compact, daisy-like cluster, typical of the genus. Eriospermum papilliferum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
